author: builder_benny
content: Regarding consolidations - my understanding is that, among other things, the withdrawal address of both source and target must be the same - is that correct? If so, can someone point me to where this is checked? (I see a check on the source withdrawal credentials here (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md#new-process_consolidation_request - see #Verify source withdrawal credentials), but not on target).

author: pulp1559
content: I haven't seen a requirement for both validators to have the same withdrawal address either. At least, like you, my interpretation is that only source withdrawal credentials is enforced to prove ownership of the validator about to be drained. The target validator is up to the owner to decide, which can have a different withdrawal credential.
